newsitem.title: USA: CSG RISES AFTER CONTRACT, RIVAL FALLS.
newsitem.headline: CSG RISES AFTER CONTRACT, RIVAL FALLS.

text.p: Shares of CSG Systems International Inc gained 15 percent after it signed two major agreements with a Tele-Communications Inc affiliate, while CSG's rival USCS International Inc dropped sharply.
CSG gained 3-3/4 to 26-7/8, while USCS dropped 10-3/4 to 20-1/4. Both firms offer customer management products and services.

Earlier on Monday, CSG said it signed a 15-year exclusive contract with TCI Cable Management Corp to consolidate 13 million of its cable television customers onto CSG's customer care and billing system.
The value of the contract was not disclosed, but one analyst estimated the deal was worth $1.8 billion over 15 years.
"It's a very good deal for them (CSG). It's a hefty contract," said Russell Welty, an analyst with Hanifen Imhoff.

CSG also said it signed an agreement to acquire the assets of its SUMMITrak system for about $106 million in cash and about $26 million in contingent payments. SUMMITrak is a customer care and billing system being tested by affiliates of TCI Communications.
CSG's gain of the billing contract was a sharp blow to rival USCS, analysts said.
"We think there will be a hit of some magnitude on USCS, but the extent of that magnitude we don't know yet," said one analyst who declined to be named.
Officials for USCS did not return calls seeking comment.
